conclusion: In the velocity selector, the electric field E is perpendicular to the magnetic field B and to the ion velocity v.
A particle that passes straight through must experience zero net transverse force, therefore qE = qvB, leading to v = E / B.
Inside the magnetic analyzer, the ions describe a circular trajectory of radius r = mv / (qB).
The analyzer is a quarter-circular ring with inner and outer radii R₁ and R₂, and the entrance and exit slits are located at the mid-line of this ring.
The only orbit that can leave through the exit slit is the one whose radius equals the mean radius of the ring: r = (R₁ + R₂)/2.
Insert the velocity obtained from the selector and the radius fixed by the analyzer: mv/qB = E/B, leading to q/m = v/(Br).
Speed of the ions after the velocity selector: v = E / B.
Charge-to-mass ratio of the ions transmitted by the magnetic analyzer: q/m = 2E / [B² (R₁ + R₂)].
